aws::graph::propositions: # Aviation Accident Analysis - Porterville, California
The accident occurred in Porterville, California.
The accident occurred on March 20, 2014, at 16:50 Local time.
The aircraft involved was an EVEKTOR-AEROTECHNIK AS SPORTSTAR.
The defining event was loss of control on ground.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation - Instructional.
The accident number was WPR14LA141.
The aircraft registration was N817EV.
The aircraft sustained substantial damage.
There were no injuries in the accident.
The student pilot reported feeling the airplane dip right during takeoff.
The student pilot reduced the throttle when the airplane dipped right.
The student pilot applied brakes when the airplane dipped right.
The airplane suddenly spun left after the student pilot reduced throttle and applied brakes.
The airplane exited the runway after spinning left.
A witness was located adjacent to the accident site.
The witness observed the airplane veer left during takeoff.
The witness heard the engine power reduce.
The witness observed the right main landing gear begin to flip around.
The airplane exited the left side of the runway.
The airplane came to rest adjacent to the runway.
The airplane was facing the opposite direction of the takeoff when it came to rest.
The right main landing gear separated from the airplane.
Postaccident examination did not reveal any preaccident mechanical anomalies.
The airplane was capable of normal operation before the accident.
Skid marks were observed on the runway.
The skid marks were consistent with all three tires skidding left to the edge of the runway.
The skid marks occurred before the right main landing gear separated.
Weather information was recorded about 5 minutes after the accident.
The wind was about 10 degrees left of the runway heading.
The wind speed was 6 knots.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of the accident.
The probable cause was the student pilot's failure to maintain directional control during takeoff.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
Porterville, California

## Date & Time: 
March 20, 2014, 16:50 Local

## Aircraft:
EVEKTOR-AEROTECHNIK AS SPORTSTAR

## Defining Event:
Loss of control on ground

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation - Instructional

## Accident Number:
WPR14LA141

## Registration:
N817EV

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
1 None

## Analysis

The student pilot reported that, during takeoff, he felt the airplane dip right. When he reduced the throttle and applied brakes, the airplane suddenly spun left and exited the runway. A witness located adjacent to the accident site reported that he observed the airplane veer left during the takeoff, that he heard the engine power reduce, and that he observed the right main landing gear begin to "flip around" as the airplane exited the left side of the runway. Subsequently, the airplane came to rest adjacent to the runway in the opposite direction of the takeoff; the right main landing gear had separated. Postaccident examination of the airplane did not reveal any preaccident mechanical anomalies that would have precluded normal operation. Skid marks observed on the runway were consistent with all three tires skidding left to the edge of the runway before the right main landing gear separated. Recorded weather information revealed that, about 5 minutes after the accident, the wind was about 10 degrees left of the runway heading at 6 knots.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be:

The student pilot's failure to maintain directional control during takeoff.

---
